subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Analyze 31 03

config.question: In which of the following areas did the Carter administration succeed, while the Reagan administration faltered?

choices.content: pursuing welfare reform in the country
improving relations between Israel and Iran
peacefully countering the spread of communism in Central America
improving relations with the Soviet Union

answer_2.response: Consider This: In the post-Vietnam world that Jimmy Carter inherited, Americans wanted little to do with world crises. Military intervention had failed in Southeast Asia. Thus, Carter would attempt to use diplomatic means other than direct military intervention in world affairs. In the 1980 election, President Carter claimed that Reagan was too reckless to conduct American foreign policy in the nuclear age. See L.O. 31.6 Reagan and the World.
